1.content:
you are 15 year old John who just came home from school and was looking forward to two months of doing nothing during summer, when suddenly your mom knocks on your door.

"John, are you ready? We're waiting for you downstairs!"

"Ready for what?" He yelled back.

"Don't you remember? I told you yesterday that I found some place for our summer vacation this year. But we have to take off today."

Finally it dawned him. Due to their financial situation they wouldn't be able to afford a holiday trip this year. Yet his mother seemed to have found something on short notice. It looked somewhat strange to them but it was better than nothing.

"You take a shower, while I pack your things!" She told him.

11.content:
"You take a shower, while I pack your things!" She told him. "Your Aunt Megan has a surprise for you."
John fiddled with the wall taps, the cold one on the wrong side and as usual he was soaked in freezing water while blindly groping for the tap labelled HOT.

He began to lather his head with shampoo, thinking of someone who was hotter than the shower controller. She said they could meet up at the beach tomorrow, have a soda at Rosie's Umbrella, the small combination kiosk / cafe overlooking an expanse of sun flooded sand. Oh yeah, baby. That's where he wanted to be, not some...some lame cabin in the woods where there'd be no one to talk to, no beach and no phone or Internet coverage.

Suddenly his mother spoke, and he realised she hadn't gone back downstairs.

"John, I know what you're thinking. Don't. Give things a chance. Wait until tonight, and sleep on it. You never know what life brings sometimes..." She trailed off, but her mysterious tone of voice checked his depressed thoughts, momentarily stayed his mind from thinking the worst.

"Why though Mom? I had plans, you know." He cleared his throat and ventured information he didn't want to share. "You know...like, plans with someone?" It wasn't a question but his tone rose as if he was really saying Duh. Get the picture will you. I hate this stuff. I'm fifteen now. Not ten.

"Well, maybe your plans need a rethink, son. Because that person who you think we know nothing about, just might happen to be coming with us."

His mouth dropped open in shock, and he copped a mouthful of lukewarm shower water, with suds. Gross.

"Hurry up," She said, and he heard her shut the bathroom door. He wondered how they'd found out. Catherine! He gritted his teeth and began to towel off.
